definition: Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
swallow (family Hirundinidae)/old variant of 宴[yan4]
variant of 燕[yan4]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This thing but proof of red of You Yanguo prince, adjure a help I am chased after return this debt.
sentences.chinese: 这件事可由燕国太子丹证明，恳请帮助我追还这笔债。

sentences.english: In 228 BC, the Qin army conquered one of the states and prepared to attack another named Yan.
sentences.chinese: 接着又准备入侵另一个叫燕国的国家。

sentences.english: Donghu is a branch of the Hu people who act actively in the Northeast of Yan.
sentences.chinese: 东胡是东周时期活跃于燕国东北面的一支胡人。

sentences.english: In the Warring States period, Yan State once had its county government in this area.
sentences.chinese: 战国时代，燕国在这里设置过郡一级的地方政府。

sentences.english: By his son, Ben Wang will take over big, Zaiqu pack of Yan.
sentences.chinese: 由他的儿子王贲接替做大将，再去收拾燕国。

sentences.english: In the midnight, the citizens within the city struck up a cacophony of noise that startled the sleeping Yan troops.
sentences.chinese: 午夜，沉睡中的燕国士兵被即墨城里刺耳的噪声惊醒。

sentences.english: In ancient times, a personal letter from Chu Ying Yan to the country.
sentences.chinese: 古时候，有个人从楚国的郢都写信给燕国的相国。

definition: Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Northern Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (409-436)
old name for Beijing 北京[Bei3 jing1]
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
vassal state
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Youzhou, ancient province in north Hebei and Liaoning/Fanyang 範陽|范阳 ancient city near modern Beijing
Prince Dan of Yan (-226 BC), commissioned the attempted assassination of King Ying Zheng of Qin 秦嬴政 (later the First Emperor 秦始皇) by Jing Ke 荆轲 in 227 BC
